message:
@Oilspill: I usually have *both* sides send a 0-length keepalive message if no other data has been sent for a given period of time (or if you want it simpler, just always send out a 0-length keepalive message periodically).  

There's no need for a timeout to detect the lost connection; if the connection has been lost, then the keepalive message will fail (because it was never ACKed), and the socket will go into an error state.
